executive_summary: Online cloud service use has skyrocketed during the current period, with major implementation occurring during 2020 as remote business activity surged following COVID-19 lockdowns. Major growth has happened since the pandemic, with organizations increasingly deploying more cloud solutions, ultimately leading to higher rates of cloud security adoption. As a result, revenue is expected to grow at a CAGR of 6.7% to $17.2 billion through 2024, supported by 15.5% growth during 2024, as profit returns to growth and makes up 19.4% of revenue.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Heightened Levels of Cloud Adoptions Lead to a Surge in Security Software Sales
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Since 2020, there has been a 14.0% climb in companies that use cloud software in their business, according to Forbes. This reflects the global economy's pivot to remote work following the pandemic, with around 94.0% of companies now using cloud solutions.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Artificial Intelligence Emerges as an Important Tool in Cloud Security
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Companies within the industry have implemented AI solutions into their security platforms to combat more sophisticated cybersecurity threats.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: CLOUD SECURITY ADVANCEMENT AND AI INVESTMENT WILL BE HIGHLY CORRELATED
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: With cyber criminals also enlisting artificial intelligence to launch more effective attacks, cloud security companies will need to make continued investments in AI to guarantee their technological advantage.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: THE GROWING COST OF DATA BREACHES IS EXPECTED TO SPARK LARGER SECURITY INVESTMENTS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Cybersecurity Ventures projects that cybercrime costs worldwide will reach $10.5 trillion by 2025.

industry_definition: Companies in this industry offer software and policies to ensure data privacy, security and protection for organizations using cloud platforms.
key_trends: Well-established companies with strong reputations dominate the industry.
Artificial intelligence is playing a larger and more important role in guaranteeing the effectiveness of industry solutions.

market_segmentation.segment_description: The financial sector is a main target for cybersecurity attacks.
E-commerce, online payments and data sharing have made security software critical for organizations.

products_and_services.product_description: Data loss prevention (DLP) solutions support industry players in protecting company and customer data from attacks.
Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) enables companies to identify and analyze security alerts.

tier_1_suppliers: Computer Peripheral Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Electric Power Transmission in the US
Intellectual Property Licensing in the US
tier_1_buyers: Healthcare and Social Assistance in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Identity and Access Management Dominates the Industry
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Identity and access management solutions aim to ensure that the user trying to access the server has the proper credentials.

business_locations.location_description: Located in California, Silicon Valley is a technology hub known globally.

FAQs.question: How reliant is your company on advertising revenue?
FAQs.answer: Companies generate revenue by selling an actual product, not through advertisements.

FAQs.question: How has the shift towards conducting business online affected demand for your services?
FAQs.answer: The shift to online business operations has opened a new delivery method for developers.
